Description: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is a measure of the total value of all goods and services produced within a country's borders over a specific time period.
Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services rises, eroding purchasing power over time.
The unemployment rate is the percentage of the labor force that is unemployed and actively seeking employment.
The bank rate is the interest rate at which a central bank lends money to commercial banks, influencing borrowing and lending rates in the economy.

The government bond rate, for instance, the US 10-year Treasury yield, represents the interest rate paid by the US government on its 10-year bonds, serving as a benchmark for long-term borrowing costs and financial market sentiment.
